intro: Vernonia conyzoides, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its rough, hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the rainy season, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. The plant is also valued for its hardiness and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
